org.javact.compiler
Class Driver

java.lang.Object
  org.javact.compiler.Driver

 class Driver
extends java.lang.Object

An instance of this class manages the processing of files and the automatic generation of message handling classes. More precisely, this class may be used to:

  • parse the options passed to the compiler;
  • parse the .java files to find ActorProfile and BehaviorProfile instances;
  • generate the message handling files;
  • generate each behavior profile's corresponding abstract QuasiBehavior class;
  • compile the automatically generated classes.

Version:
0.5.0
Author:
Vincent Hennebert

Constructor Detail

Driver

Driver(java.util.List argsList)
Creates a new Driver instance.

Parameters:
argsList - String list of the parameters passed to the compiler, including options and .java files to parse.
Method Detail

parseOptions

void parseOptions()
Parses the compilation options. The option items are removed from the argsList when this method terminates. Thus it should be called before the invocation of the findActorProfiles(java.util.Iterator) method, unless no options were given.

See Also:
Options.parseOptions(java.util.Iterator)

parseActorProfiles

void parseActorProfiles()
Parses the files given at this Driver instance creation. Finds the ActorProfile interfaces, extracts their behavior interfaces and their corresponding messages. Note that the parseOptions() should already have been invoked, such that the option items are removed from the argsList.

generateQuasiBehaviors

void generateQuasiBehaviors()
Generates the behavior profiles' abstract classes. For each BehaviorProfile interface BP, generates the BPQuasiBehavior abstract class.

generateMessages

void generateMessages()
Generates the message handling java files.

See Also:
Message.generateMessages()

compileFiles

int compileFiles()
Compile generated messages and all the remaining files of the command-line.

Returns:
the result of the compilation
